title: 107_hr5713
content: The Tax Technical Corrections Act of 2002 is the short title of this Act, amending the 1986 Code. The table of contents for this Act is provided. The Tax Technical Corrections Act of 2002 includes amendments related to various tax relief acts from previous years, such as the Job Creation and Worker Assistance Act of 2002, Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001, Victims of Terrorism Tax Relief Act of 2001, Community Renewal Tax Relief Act of 2000, and Taxpayer Relief Act of 1997. It also includes other technical corrections and clerical amendments. Amendments related to Section 101 of the Act involve changes to section 168(k)(2), including the removal of a condition for property acquisition before September 11, 2001, and the exclusion of property under written binding contracts before that date. Amendments to section 168(k)(2) include inserting clauses and striking words to modify conditions for property placed in service after September 10, 2001. Amendments related to Section 102 of the Act involve changes to section 172(b)(1) and net operating losses for the year 2001. Amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 allow for timely filing of losses before November 1, 2002, and the revocation of certain elections before the same date. Additionally, changes are made to various sections related to taxable years and carryovers. Amendments related to taxable years and carryovers are made to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, including changes to sections 1400L(a)(2) and 1400L(b)(2) regarding New York Liberty Zone property. The text chunk discusses amendments related to the acquisition of property and changes to the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974. The amendments made in this section relate to the Job Creation and Worker Assistance Act of 2002, specifically regarding changes to Section 411 of the Act. The effective date of these amendments is retroactive to the provisions of the original Act. Amendments related to the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001 are discussed in this section. Amendments related to various sections of the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001 are made, including adjustments to qualified higher education expenses, provisions for adjustments in accordance with specific methods, and determinations of certain amounts without regard to specific sections. The effective date for these amendments is retroactive to the original Act. SEC. 4 amends section 6103(i)(7)(B) by inserting "and subparagraph (A)" after "this subparagraph". The effective date is retroactive to the Victims of Terrorism Tax Relief Act of 2001. SEC. 5 makes amendments related to the Community Renewal Tax Relief Act of 2000. The amendments related to Section 401 of the Act involve regulations on contracts and options tied to narrow-based security indexes. The effective date for these amendments is specified. The effective date for the amendments related to contracts and options tied to narrow-based security indexes is as if included in the Community Renewal Tax Relief Act of 2000. SEC. 6. AMENDMENTS RELATED TO TAXPAYER RELIEF ACT OF 1997. Amendments related to Section 1001 of the Taxpayer Relief Act of 1997 include changes to the definition of a constructive sale in section 1259(c). These changes clarify that a taxpayer will not be considered to have made a constructive sale solely by entering into a contract. Other amendments involve specifying the timing of certain actions and removing the term "substantially similar" from the language. Amendments to section 1259(c) clarify constructive sale definition and timing of actions. Section 4261(e)(4) is also amended. Amendments to section 4261(e)(4) clarify tax rates for amounts paid for domestic segments starting after 2002. Effective dates for amendments related to sections 1001 and 1031 are specified. SEC. 7. OTHER TECHNICAL CORRECTIONS. Amends the definition of a valid taxpayer identification number for the Earned Income Credit. Effective for taxable years after the enactment of this Act. SEC. 8. CLERICAL AMENDMENTS. SEC. 8. CLERICAL AMENDMENTS. Amends headings, table of sections, and text in a tax relief act.
